title: Dozens of volunteers canvas Boston for homeless people outside as blizzard bears down on the city
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Volunteers from Pine Street Inn canvassed Boston during a blizzard to assist homeless individuals and encourage them to seek shelter.
The outreach teams encountered 50 people overnight as the storm began, offering warm supplies and rides to shelters.
Pine Street Inn shelters, with a 585-bed capacity, housed over 660 people using additional cots and mats during the storm.

title: 50 percent of departing Boston Logan Airport flights canceled Tuesday
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: More than 50% of Tuesday flights canceled at Logan Airport due to a nor'easter affecting New England.
Amtrak suspended service between Boston's South Station and New York Moynihan Train Hall on Monday.
MassPort advises passengers to check with airlines as flight resumptions depend on conditions after the storm.

title: To trade or not to trade? Bruins must make their call with Viktor Arvidsson.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Viktor Arvidsson has revitalized his scoring form with 14 goals and 28 points in 45 games for the Bruins.
The Boston Bruins must decide whether to trade Arvidsson before the March 6 deadline for draft picks or keep him for a playoff push.
The Bruins are in a wild card spot with a 61% playoff chance, but trading Arvidsson could hinder their postseason aspirations.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Tuesday, Feb. 24.
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: A massive snowstorm has led to school closures across Massachusetts for Tuesday, Feb. 24.
Over 30 inches of snow have fallen in parts of Massachusetts due to the ongoing blizzard.
Boston, Cambridge, Worcester, and over 100 other districts announced closure due to severe weather conditions.

title: AJ Brown recalls ‘critical’ Mike Vrabel moments that changed hatred to respect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: AJ Brown once disliked coach Mike Vrabel, writing 'I hate Vrabel' in his notebook during meetings.
Brown's respect for Vrabel grew after realizing the coach's tough approach aimed to push him to excel.
Brown, now with the Eagles, is a potential trade candidate for the Patriots, who need receiver improvements.

title: US women’s hockey declines invite to State of the Union, men’s hockey also invited in viral Trump phone call
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: US women's hockey team declined President Trump's State of the Union invitation due to prior academic and professional commitments.
US men's hockey team invited to State of the Union and White House after winning gold against Canada.
Trump joked about inviting US women's team during a celebration call with the men's team after their victory.

title: Patriots cut running back Antonio Gibson to save cap space
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots have released running back Antonio Gibson, freeing over $3 million in cap space.
Gibson was recovering from a torn ACL suffered in Week 5 of the 2025 season.
New England's depth chart now includes Rhamondre Stevenson, TreVeyon Henderson, Terrell Jennings, Elijah Mitchell, and Lan Larison.

title: Yes, this storm is officially a blizzard. Here’s what meteorologists want you to know.
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Meteorologists declared a blizzard in parts of Massachusetts and Rhode Island, including Boston and Providence, on Monday.
Blizzard criteria include visibility dropping below 1/4 mile for three hours with winds of at least 35 mph.
Blizzard warnings predict wind gusts up to 75 mph, causing power outages, tree damage, and hazardous travel conditions.

title: Video captures blizzard conditions in downtown Boston
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Photographer Jack Coen documented fierce blizzard conditions in downtown Boston outside the Old State House.
Snowfall in Massachusetts could reach 18 to 24 inches with heavy snowfall and damaging wind gusts.
Nor'easter caused 14 inches of snow at 1Lofts mill apartments in Pawtucket, R.I. on Monday morning.

title: Tom Brady’s WWE comments have landed him at the top of Randy Orton’s RKO list
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Randy Orton joked about hitting Tom Brady with an RKO after Brady's comments on WWE during Logan Paul's podcast.
Brady, participating in the Fanatics Flag Football Classic, downplayed wrestling's athleticism compared to football.
Brady will join NFL stars like Saquon Barkley and Rob Gronkowski for the flag football event exhibition.
